TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit StylusPointCollection extends System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1<valuetype System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint>

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> has a StylusPointCollection that contains <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects collected from a stylus and digitizer. You can use the StylusPointCollection to customize the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
## Examples The following example overrides the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.DrawCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to draw a circle at each <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> comprising a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>. If the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.FitToCurve%2A> property is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetBezierStylusPoints%2A> method returns the stylus points. Otherwise, the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.StylusPoints%2A> property returns the stylus points.
[!code-cs[StrokeSnippets#23](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeSnippets_CS/MyStroke.cs#23)] [!code-vb[StrokeSnippets#23](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeSnippets_VB/MyStroke.vb#23)]

remarks.format:

The example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> by specifying the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> and the initial size of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you use the StylusPointCollection constructor to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>, you specify it's . However, you can add more <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Add%2A> method.
## Examples The following example collects <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects in the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnStylusDown%2A> method of a custom control. The example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> by specifying both the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> and the initial size of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>.

## Remarks When you use the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>, the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> is created with the capacity to hold the specified number of <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects. You can add more <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects than by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Add%2A> method.
## Examples The following example collects <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects in the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnStylusDown%2A> method of a custom control. The example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> by specifying the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> and the initial size of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>.

## Examples The following example demonstrates how to copy a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>. The example creates a stroke comprised of members of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> and adds them to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> called `inkcanvs1`.

public System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection Reformat (System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription subsetToReformatTo);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection Reformat(class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription subsetToReformatTo) cil managed

Docs.param: A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"> to intersect with the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"> of the current <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>.
Docs.summary: Finds the intersection of the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"> and the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description%2A> property.
Docs.returns: A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"> that has a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> that is a subset of the specified <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> and the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> that the current <see cref="T:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"> uses.

remarks.format:
## Remarks is a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> which describes a subset of values belonging to the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description%2A> property. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription.GetCommonDescription%2A> method to get a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> that intersects the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description%2A> of the current <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>.
The Reformat method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> that contains the same <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects as those belonging to the current <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>. The <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects in the new <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> uses as the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription>.
> [!NOTE] > Reformat uses the constraints from the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointPropertyInfo> of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description%2A> property, even if the constraints in are different. For example, if uses the values 0 and 1023 for <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperties.NormalPressure> whereas <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description%2A> uses the values 0 and 255. Reformat returns a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> using the values, 0 and 255.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> that uses a different <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription>.
[!code-cs[PacketSpy#17](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/PacketSpy/Window1.xaml.cs#17)] [!code-vb[PacketSpy#17](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/PacketSpy/Window1.xaml.vb#17)]
